oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Little children, among the Bushmen, are not allowed to eat the heart of the Jackal, on account of its great timidity. The heart of the Leopard may, on the contrary, be eaten by them. By /han=kasso (L VIII-16. 7457-7459).
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Children do not eat jackal's hearts
